Package pa1.ministers

Class Minister

  • java.lang.Object
    • pa1.ministers.Minister
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Economist, Scientist, WarGeneral
    public abstract class Minister
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract class that represents a minister in the game. All actions in the game are done through ministers. Therefore this class will contain the bulk of your implementation of the game.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.lang.String attackCity​(City attacker, City defender, int attackingTroops, java.util.List<Technology> technologies)
      Attack a target city Call the overloaded method below with ministerBonus = 0.8 Will be overridden in the WarGeneral class
      protected java.lang.String attackCity​(City attacker, City defender, int attackingTroops, java.util.List<Technology> technologies, double ministerBonus)
      Attack a target city Attacking city loses troops equal to min(# of troops attacking, # of troops in the defending city) Defending city loses min( round(ministerBonus * product of tech attack bonuses * # of attacking troops), # of troops in the defending city ) This method is overridden in the WarGeneral class Print the following messages: "[attacker city name] loses [number of troops lost by attacker] troops while attacking" "[defender city name] loses [number of troops lost by defender] troops while defending"
      void beginTurn()
      Changes isReady to true
      void buildBank​(Player player, City city)
      Build a bank in the city 1.
      void buildRoad​(Player player, City city)
      Build a road in the city 1.
      void buildUniversity​(Player player, City city)
      Build a university in the city 1.
      int collectProductionPoints​(City city)
      Collect production points from a city amount collected = (city population + minister intelligence + minister leadership) * (# of roads + 1) * 0.2
      int collectSciencePoints​(City city)
      Collect science points from a city amount collected = (city population + minister experience + minister intelligence) * (# of universities + 1) * 0.2
      int collectTax​(City city)
      Collect gold from a city amount collected = (city population + minister experience + minister leadership) * (# of banks + 1) * 0.2
      void endTurn()
      Changes isReady to false
      int getExperience()  
      double getImprovementDiscountRate()
      Minister by default does not provide improvement discount rate therefore this method always returns 1.

      double getTechDiscountRate()
      Minister by default does not provide tech discount rate therefore this method always returns 1.
      void improveCropYield​(Player player, City city)
      Improve the crop yields in a city Improve Crop yields by 50 for 500 golds If the player does not have enough gold, throw an exception Else decrease 500 golds from the player and improves crops by 50
      boolean isReady()  
      void recruitTroops​(Player player, City city)
      Recruit troops to be stationed in a city Recruit 50 troops for 500 golds If the player does not have enough gold, throw an exception

        Whether or not the minister is ready

      • getImprovementDiscountRate

        public double getImprovementDiscountRate()
        Minister by default does not provide improvement discount rate therefore this method always returns 1. This behavior may be overridden in a sub-class
        Returns:
        1

      • getTechDiscountRate

        public double getTechDiscountRate()
        Minister by default does not provide tech discount rate therefore this method always returns 1. This behavior may be overridden in a sub-class
        Returns:
        1

      • beginTurn

        Changes isReady to true

      • collectTax

        public int collectTax​(City city)
        Collect gold from a city amount collected = (city population + minister experience + minister leadership) * (# of banks + 1) * 0.2

        Returns:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • buildBank

        public void buildBank​(Player player,
                      City city)
               throws TooPoorException
        Build a bank in the city 1. Get the cost of building a bank, with applied minister discount 2. Check whether player has enough gold and production points 3. If not, throw an exception 4. Subtract the cost from the player's gold and production point 5. Add number of bank in the city by one

        HINT: - the Cost class has a getDiscountedCost() method - the Minister class has a getImprovementDiscountRate() method, to obtain the discount rate of building a bank

        Parameters:
        player -
        city -
        Throws:
        TooPoorException

      • buildRoad

        public void buildRoad​(Player player,
                      City city)
               throws TooPoorException
        Build a road in the city 1. Get the cost of building a road, with applied minister discount 2. Check whether player has enough gold and production points 3. If not, throw an exception 4. Subtract the cost from the player's gold and production point 5. Add number of road in the city by one

        HINT: - the Cost class has a getDiscountedCost() method - the Minister class has a getImprovementDiscountRate() method, to obtain the discount rate of building a road

        Parameters:
        player -
        city -
        Throws:
        TooPoorException

      • buildUniversity

        public void buildUniversity​(Player player,
                            City city)
                     throws TooPoorException
        Build a university in the city 1. Get the cost of building a university, with applied minister discount 2. Check whether player has enough gold and production points 3. If not, throw an exception 4. Subtract the cost from the player's gold and production point 5. Add number of university in the city by one

        HINT: - the Cost class has a getDiscountedCost() method - the Minister class has a getImprovementDiscountRate() method, to obtain the discount rate of building a university

        Parameters:
        player -
        city -
        Throws:
        TooPoorException

      • attackCity

        public java.lang.String attackCity​(City attacker,
                                   City defender,
                                   int attackingTroops,
                                   java.util.List<Technology> technologies)
        Attack a target city Call the overloaded method below with ministerBonus = 0.8 Will be overridden in the WarGeneral class
        Parameters:
        attacker - attacking city
        defender - defending city
        attackingTroops - number of troops deployed for the attack
        technologies - technologies owned by the attacking player

      • attackCity

        protected java.lang.String attackCity​(City attacker,
                                      City defender,
                                      int attackingTroops,
                                      java.util.List<Technology> technologies,
                                      double ministerBonus)
        Attack a target city Attacking city loses troops equal to min(# of troops attacking, # of troops in the defending city) Defending city loses min( round(ministerBonus * product of tech attack bonuses * # of attacking troops), # of troops in the defending city ) This method is overridden in the WarGeneral class Print the following messages: "[attacker city name] loses [number of troops lost by attacker] troops while attacking" "[defender city name] loses [number of troops lost by defender] troops while defending"
        Parameters:
        attacker - attacking city
        defender - defending city
        attackingTroops - number of troops deployed for the attack
        technologies - technologies owned by the attacking player

      • improveCropYield

        public void improveCropYield​(Player player,
                             City city)
                      throws TooPoorException
        Improve the crop yields in a city Improve Crop yields by 50 for 500 golds If the player does not have enough gold, throw an exception Else decrease 500 golds from the player and improves crops by 50

        This method is overridden in the Economist class

        Parameters:
        player -
        city -
        Throws:
        TooPoorException

      • recruitTroops

        public void recruitTroops​(Player player,
                          City city)
                   throws TooPoorException
        Recruit troops to be stationed in a city Recruit 50 troops for 500 golds If the player does not have enough gold, throw an exception

        Overridden in WarGeneral class

        Parameters:
        player -
        city -
        Throws:
        TooPoorException

      • upgradeTech

        public void upgradeTech​(Player player,
                        Technology technology)
                 throws TooPoorException
        Upgrades tech 1. Get the cost of upgrading tech, with applied minister discount 2. Check whether player has enough gold, production, and science points 3. If not, throw an exception 4. Subtract the costs from the player's balance 5. Add level of technology by one

        HINT: - the Cost class has a getDiscounterCost() method - the Minister class has a getTechDiscountRate() method

        Parameters:
        player -
        technology -
        Throws:
        TooPoorException
